solution_line_template: The first and last guard will take {first_guard_hours} + {last_guard_hours} = <<{first_guard_hours}+{last_guard_hours}={hours_taken_by_first_and_last_guard}>>{hours_taken_by_first_and_last_guard} hours of the night shift.

There are {total_shift_hours} hours in the night shift, so the middle two guards will cover {total_shift_hours} - {hours_taken_by_first_and_last_guard} = <<{total_shift_hours}-{hours_taken_by_first_and_last_guard}={remaining_hours_for_middle_guards}>>{remaining_hours_for_middle_guards} hours.

Each middle guard will take {remaining_hours_for_middle_guards} / {num_middle_guards} = <<{remaining_hours_for_middle_guards}/{num_middle_guards}={hours_per_middle_guard}>>{hours_per_middle_guard} hours.
